title: How to remove a "Content type" from the "Download actions" (Applications) list in Firefox?
content:
I only want to remove the "whatsapp" content type because I prefer to open it in Firefox rather than in the Windows app. I've uninstalled Whatsapp from Windows, but the option is still in Firefox's "Applications" list. I wouldn't want to reset all the settings just to remove this entry.

Is there a way to remove just this entry in the content type?
creator: jhonguedes

title: Text box becomes unresponsive every 7 seconds when I type comments in YouTube.
content:
I have no problems typing in a textbox on most websites, but for some time now, when I type comments on YouTube, the box alternates between working and freezing about every 7 seconds. It will work fine for 7 seconds. Then freeze for 7 seconds, then back to working again.

Any idea what the problem is?

title: Tab pickup - sync Firefox on your phone or tablet message
content:
Greetings.... Somehow a page (see uploaded image) continually appears in Firefox with "Sync Firefox on your phone or tablet", showing it is 33% complete. I'm guessing this process was started by accident since I don't use a cell phone except for GPS, but it also says tablet... so who knows.

The top of the page says "Tab pickup". I cannot stop this page from constantly appearing and can only get rid of it by shutting down my computer. Please help me get rid of this. I have downloaded several articles but not sure what they are talking about and afraid to do something that could make something else worse. This is so very frustrating. Non-techie, no kids, grand kids... 81 years old with no one to ask. Love using firefox but this problem makes it very challenging. Thanks so much for being there for me. e-mail: colemanfineart@verizon.net Best, Midge Coleman

title: Some Asian scripts are not rendered properly
content:
If I display (e.g.) Nepal in Google maps, initially the Nepali names appear beneath the Latin alphabet names, but only for a split second. They are then overwritten with unicode block icons. Some scripts work (e.g. Cyrillic, Chinese, Japanese, Armenian), but most south Asian scripts do this weird "works for a split second" rendering.

I'm running 128.8.0esr (64-bit) on Debian 12.

This problem does NOT occur in Safe Mode!

In Normal mode, I disabled all plugins and extensions, but the rendering still breaks.

Any ideas?

The same page renders properly in Chrome 134.0.6998.88

title: How to change viewport background color?
content:
If letterboxing (anti-fingerprinting) is used or when a webpage is smaller than the window (such as in about:config), Firefox fills in the rest of the window using a dark gray. I want to make it completely black.

This is what I currently have in my userContent.css

```CSS @-moz-document url-prefix("about"), url-prefix("chrome"){ 

 body{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };  .sticky-container{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };  #toolbar{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };

}@-moz-document url-prefix("about"), url-prefix("chrome"){ 

 body{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };  .sticky-container{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };  #toolbar{ background-color: rgb(0 0 0) !important };

} ```
